sentences: Butch Miles (born Charles J. Thorton, Jr. on July 4, 1944) is an American jazz drummer.
Miles, who cites Buddy Rich, Gene Krupa, and Jo Jones as favorite drummers, began playing snare drum at the age of nine and majored in music at West Virginia State University (1962–1966).
He was Mel Torme's drummer for 3 1/2 years and it was Torme and Buddy Rich who recommended Miles to Count Basie when a drummer was needed.
Miles was with the Count Basie Orchestra from 1975 to 1979, returning for ten years from 1997 to 2007.
From Count Basie’s autobiography (published in 1985): “Butch came to us from Mel Torme’s outfit.
He was a real crowd pleaser, like Buddy Rich and Sonny Payne, and he picked up on things very nicely, and he was also interested in sticking around for a while, which he did, for about four years.”
Miles was leader of the group Jazz Express in the 1980s and 1990s.
He is a member of the West Virginia Music Hall of Fame 2011 class of inductees.
He is currently a professor in the School of Music at Texas State University-San Marcos.
